title: Orchestr8 UI Component Assessment - v3.0 Readiness Report
scope: All 6 SCOUT-UI reports consolidated into strategic findings

component_status.status_summary: All 7 acceptance criteria met. Production-ready with minor enhancement opportunities.
Exceeds acceptance criteria. Excellent Carl integration and graceful degradation. Approved for production.
Critical integration gaps with louis_core. No actual file locking functionality implemented. Estimated fix: 4-6 hours.
Production-ready. All 7 acceptance criteria exceeded. Excellent architecture and error handling.
Core functionality works. Score 85/100. Missing JSON table rendering and some UX polish.
Exceptionally well-structured. Clean plugin architecture with STATE_MANAGERS pattern. Production-ready.

blocking_issues.impact: Plugin implements own config management instead of using shared louis_core module. Creates config inconsistency risk.
Plugin only manages protection config paths but doesn't call LouisWarden.lock_file() or unlock_file(). Core feature is missing.
Acceptance criteria requires bulk locking feature. Not implemented.

blocking_issues.issue: No per-file toggle for selected file
blocking_issues.impact: Should integrate with selected_file state from Explorer. Not implemented.

critical_issues.description: JSON output displayed as raw text in code blocks instead of interactive tables
critical_issues.recommendation: Detect JSON output with try/except json.loads(), render with mo.ui.table()

critical_issues.description: Results truncated at 2000 chars without indication - user may miss important data
critical_issues.recommendation: Add '... (truncated)' suffix or expandable/downloadable full output

critical_issues.issue: Phase state not persisted across page reloads
critical_issues.description: Phase progress lost if user refreshes browser. State initialized fresh each render.
critical_issues.recommendation: Persist wizard state to STATE_MANAGERS dict

critical_issues.issue: No input validation before phase lock
critical_issues.description: Empty fields can be locked without validation
critical_issues.recommendation: Add required field validation in lock_phase()

minor_issues.description: Uses 'from carl_core import' without IP module prefix
minor_issues.mitigation: Handled by try/except block, but could be more robust

minor_issues.description: Creates UI element but never uses it - auto-detection works fine
louis_core uses ~/.louis-control/ while plugin uses project/.louis-control/
No mechanism to prevent simultaneous plugin runs
minor_issues.recommendation: Disable all run buttons when is_loading is true

minor_issues.description: Uses generic 'except Exception' instead of specific types

recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Replace custom config with LouisConfig, implement actual file locking via LouisWarden
acceptance_criteria: Import and use louis_core.LouisWarden for file operations
Add per-file toggle for selected_file from Explorer

recommendations_for_v3_0.description: Add JSON table rendering for structured output
recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Detect JSON in plugin results and render as interactive mo.ui.table
acceptance_criteria: Render with mo.ui.table() instead of text block

recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Store wizard state in STATE_MANAGERS to survive page reloads
recommendations_for_v3_0.implementation: Add 'wizard_state' key to STATE_MANAGERS dict, serialize/deserialize phase progress

recommendations_for_v3_0.description: Add comprehensive input validation across plugins
recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Validate required fields before state updates in Generator and Gatekeeper
recommendations_for_v3_0.implementation: Add validation functions in lock_phase() and similar state-locking operations

recommendations_for_v3_0.description: Improve user feedback during long-running operations
recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Add progress indicators for Carl deep scans, plugin execution

recommendations_for_v3_0.description: Display plugin load/render errors in UI instead of console only
recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Add debug tab or error banner for failed plugin initialization

recommendations_for_v3_0.description: Extract sys.path manipulation patterns into helper functions
recommendations_for_v3_0.scope: Reduce code duplication in Connie and CLI Bridge

strengths: STATE_MANAGERS pattern is elegant and well-executed across all components
Plugin isolation via STATE_MANAGERS injection prevents cross-component coupling
Graceful degradation in Explorer (Carl optional) and Connie (fallback mode)
Comprehensive error handling with user-friendly feedback
Clean separation of concerns across plugins
concerns: Gatekeeper breaks pattern by not integrating with louis_core module
Some components duplicate sys.path manipulation logic
State persistence strategies vary across components

integration_points.state_managers_integration: Excellent - All 6 components properly use STATE_MANAGERS pattern
integration_points.cross_component_communication: Via STATE_MANAGERS shared state: root, files, selected, logs

unit_tests_needed: Generator: Phase locking with empty fields validation
Connie: Export format detection and rendering
CLI Bridge: JSON output parsing and table rendering
integration_tests_needed: Explorer selects file → Gatekeeper shows per-file toggle
Generator export → File created in project root
Connie export → File written with correct format
CLI Bridge plugin execution → Results logged to STATE_MANAGERS

deployment_strategy: 1. Deploy HOST and EXPLORER first (foundation layer)
2. Deploy CONNIE and GENERATOR (they work independently)
3. Deploy CLI_BRIDGE with known limitation on JSON rendering
4. DEFER GATEKEEPER until rework is complete
5. Conduct integration testing before v3.0 release
6. Gatekeeper can be released as v3.1 patch after rework
final_assessment: The Orchestr8 UI component suite is 83% ready for v3.0 production deployment. Five of six components meet or exceed acceptance criteria with production-quality code. Only Gatekeeper requires rework to properly integrate with louis_core. Recommended approach: deploy four working components in v3.0, release reworked Gatekeeper in v3.1. This de-risks the release while maintaining momentum on completed work.
